categories.name: Underweight
categories.nutrition_goal: Safe weight gain and improved nutrient intake.
dietitian_advice: Eat 3 meals + 1-2 healthy snacks.
Increase calorie intake gradually using nutrient-dense foods.
Include a balance of carbohydrates, protein, and fats in every meal.
Eat protein-rich foods.
Include healthy fats.
Avoid skipping meals.
Consult a doctor for possible underlying causes such as illness or metabolic problems.

categories.name: Normal Weight
categories.nutrition_goal: Maintain a healthy weight and prevent diseases.
dietitian_advice: Follow Pinggang Pinoy every meal.
Limit sugary, salty, and fatty foods.
Stay physically active.

categories.name: Overweight
categories.nutrition_goal: Gradual weight loss and better metabolic health.
dietitian_advice: Focus on gradual and sustainable weight management, not crash dieting.
Limit intake of sugary, salty, and saturated fats.
Reduce portion size while increasing vegetables, fruits, and fiber-rich foods.
Choose healthier cooking methods like steaming, boiling, and grilling.
Be physically active with regular exercise.
Set realistic weight goals and track progress consistently.

categories.name: Obese
categories.nutrition_goal: Sustainable weight management and reduced health risk.
dietitian_advice: Practice food portion control.
Avoid sugary, fried, and processed food.
Emphasize whole foods, high-fiber meals, and adequate protein intake.
Seek professional guidance for a structured and individualized meal plan.
Avoid late-night eating or stress eating.
Have daily physical activity appropriate to your health status.
Consult a doctor for possible underlying causes such as illness or metabolic problems.

important_reminders: BMI is a screening tool, not a diagnosis.
Pregnant women, children, and elderly individuals need special guidance.
Maintain a healthy lifestyle: proper diet, physical activity, enough sleep, and stress management.
Always consult a doctor for possible underlying medical or metabolic conditions.
